page.title: 16Public Houses in Ash.
page.content: There are twelve public houses in Ash in our block. Two are more that 400 years old. The majority sell food mainly snacks at the bar. Children are catered for in more that half of them. The most popular drinks sold are Real Ale and Lager. Nearly all the buildings date from the mid-nineteenth century when the population of the village rapidly increased because of the building of the Aldershot Barracks. Some of the pubs hire rooms to local clubs for their weekly meetings. The variety of names reflect the many aspects of the local area - The Bricklayer's Arms, The Swan, The Dover (Drover) Arms, The King's Head, The Chester Arms, The Lion Brewery, The Standard or England, The Cricketers, The Greyhound and The Admiral Napier.
